headline: Microsoft 365 Still Weakest Link as Healthcare Email Breaches Continue on Pace With 2024, New Paubox Report Warns
summary: SAN FRANCISCO, September 05, 2025--Cybercriminals are increasingly targeting Microsoft 365 environments, with the world's most widely-used business email platform now accounting for 52% of all healthcare email breaches—a dramatic surge from 43% just one year ago.

headline: Anthropic agrees to pay $1.5 billion to settle author class action
summary: (Reuters) -Anthropic told a San Francisco federal judge on Friday that it has agreed to pay $1.5 billion to settle a class-action lawsuit from a group of authors who accused the artificial intelligence company of using their books to train its AI chatbot Claude without permission.  The plaintiffs in a court filing asked U.S. District Judge William Alsup to approve the settlement, after announcing the agreement in August without disclosing the terms or amount.  "This settlement sends a powerful message to AI companies and creators alike that taking copyrighted works from these pirate websites is wrong,” the authors' lawyers said in a statement.

raw.headline: Anthropic agrees to pay $1.5 billion to settle author class action
raw.summary: (Reuters) -Anthropic told a San Francisco federal judge on Friday that it has agreed to pay $1.5 billion to settle a class-action lawsuit from a group of authors who accused the artificial intelligence company of using their books to train its AI chatbot Claude without permission.  The plaintiffs in a court filing asked U.S. District Judge William Alsup to approve the settlement, after announcing the agreement in August without disclosing the terms or amount.  "This settlement sends a powerful message to AI companies and creators alike that taking copyrighted works from these pirate websites is wrong,” the authors' lawyers said in a statement.

headline: Goldman Sachs says the AI trade could lose steam
summary: Goldman Sachs (GS) analysts warned investors that the artificial intelligence (AI) trade could cool off. The analysts cite AI-focused capital expenditure (CapEx) peaks and enterprise plays falling short, especially given AI stocks' high valuations. These themes are expected to be in focus during Goldman's upcoming Communicopia and Tech Conference. Co-head of TMT Research at Goldman Sachs, Eric Sheridan, joins Opening Bid to discuss what's next in the AI trade. Tune in to Yahoo Finance starting Monday, Sept. 8 for live coverage of Goldman Sachs's 2025 Communacopia and Technology Conference. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

headline: Alphabet Within Striking Range of $3 Trillion as Key Risk Clears
summary: The decision by a US district court judge Tuesday enabled Google’s parent to avoid the most punitive measures sought by regulators, including the sale of its Chrome browser.  With the case now out of the way, investors are turning their attention back to the potential for gains in Alphabet’s stock, which is the cheapest among the Magnificent Seven despite the recent rally.  “What it does is it clears the runway for additional growth opportunities,” said Neville Javeri, senior fund manager at Allspring Global Investments, referring to the ruling.

raw.headline: Alphabet Within Striking Range of $3 Trillion as Key Risk Clears
raw.summary: The decision by a US district court judge Tuesday enabled Google’s parent to avoid the most punitive measures sought by regulators, including the sale of its Chrome browser.  With the case now out of the way, investors are turning their attention back to the potential for gains in Alphabet’s stock, which is the cheapest among the Magnificent Seven despite the recent rally.  “What it does is it clears the runway for additional growth opportunities,” said Neville Javeri, senior fund manager at Allspring Global Investments, referring to the ruling.

headline: What's Going On With Marvell Technology Stock Friday?
summary: Marvell Technology (NASDAQ:MRVL) stock trended Friday after competitor Broadcom (NASDAQ:AVGO) delivered strong quarterly earnings. Marvell seeks to challenge Broadcom’s market dominance by concentrating on high-performance data center networking, custom AI silicon, and optical interconnects. Broadcom, in turn, maintains its formidable position through a broad product portfolio spanning semiconductors, storage, networking, and wireless technologies. Also Read: Marvell Set To Double AI Chip Sales

Analysts proclaim there is a "nuclear renaissance" underway.

headline: AI Can Help With Retirement Planning, but It Can’t Replace a Human Advisor
summary: Haywood Talcove recently tasked his financial advisors and ChatGPT with reviewing the portfolio he manages for his mother, Dotty, an 84-year-old widow.  The human advisors gave the portfolio a once-over and offered a simple qualitative assessment, while the AI offered a more detailed analysis, including a breakdown of the different sectors represented and the income Dotty receives from each of her dividend stocks.  “I have much more confidence in AI,” says Talcove, CEO of government business at LexisNexis Risk Solutions, who employs two major financial firms he declined to name to manage his own money.

raw.headline: AI Can Help With Retirement Planning, but It Can’t Replace a Human Advisor
raw.summary: Haywood Talcove recently tasked his financial advisors and ChatGPT with reviewing the portfolio he manages for his mother, Dotty, an 84-year-old widow.  The human advisors gave the portfolio a once-over and offered a simple qualitative assessment, while the AI offered a more detailed analysis, including a breakdown of the different sectors represented and the income Dotty receives from each of her dividend stocks.  “I have much more confidence in AI,” says Talcove, CEO of government business at LexisNexis Risk Solutions, who employs two major financial firms he declined to name to manage his own money.

headline: Trump Basks in Tech Leaders’ Spending Vows at White House Dinner
summary: In his opening remarks, Trump addressed a key concern of tech companies: ensuring there’s enough energy to meet surging power demands from the data centers behind the AI boom.  Thursday’s dinner marked a rare gathering in Washington of top executives and founders from some of the world’s most valuable tech companies — all vying for an edge in the emerging field of AI.
